pages.text: TFC の世界には動物がたくさんいます。 あなたのTFCライフを助けてくれる動物もいれば、非常に危険な動物もいます。 このセクションでは野生動物について説明します。 必要なアイテムを提供してくれる家畜や動物の詳細については、$(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry)牧畜$() ページを参照してください。
動物はいくつかの異なるカテゴリに分類できます: $(l:the_world/wild_animals#predators)肉食動物$()、$(l:the_world/wild_animals#prey)獲物$()、$(l:the_world/wild_animals#aquatic) )水生$() 動物。$(br2)次の数ページでは、これらの動物の各カテゴリについて詳しく説明します。
$(thing)肉食動物$() は、プレイヤーを攻撃する可能性のある動物です。 それらは、夜のみ狩猟する $(thing)夜行性$() か、日中のみ狩猟する $(thing)昼行性$() のいずれかです。 肉食動物は、最近ターゲットを殺害したかどうかに応じて、中立にも敵対にもなります。 肉食動物にはなわばりがあり、十分に遠くまで逃げれば、肉食動物は追いかけるのをやめてなわばりに戻ります。
pages.title: 肉食動物

pages.name: Polar Bear
pages.text: The polar bear spawns in only the coldest regions, $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() at most 10°C, with a $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 100mm.

pages.name: Grizzly Bear
pages.text: The grizzly bear spawns in forests of moderate climates, with a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() range of -15 to 15°C and at least 200mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$().

pages.name: Black Bear
pages.text: The black bear spawns in forests of warmer, wetter climates, of $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() 5 to 20°C and at least 250mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$().

pages.name: Cougar
pages.text: The cougar prefers most moderate climates, with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() from -10 to 21°C and at least 150mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$().

pages.name: Panther
pages.text: The panther prefers most moderate climates, with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() from -10 to 21°C and at least 150mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$().

pages.name: Lion
pages.text: The lion spawns in plains with an average $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 16°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 50 and 300mm.

pages.name: Tiger
pages.text: The tiger spawns in forests with an average $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 13°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() above 100mm.

pages.name: Sabertooth
pages.text: The sabertooth spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() above 0°C, and any $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() above 250mm.

The wolf spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 22°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 150 and 420mm. They hunt in packs. Feeding a wolf enough times will tame it into a $(l:mechanics/pets)Dog$().

The direwolf spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below freezing, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 150 and 420mm. They hunt in packs. They are larger than regular wolves, and are not tamable.

The hyena spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() warmer than 15°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 80 and 380mm. They hunt in packs. They are not tamable.

pages.name: Crocodile
pages.text: The crocodile spawns near rivers, lakes, and marshes at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() warmer than 15°C, and at any $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$(). They are nocturnal, and most dangerous in the water.

The ocelot attacks small animals. It spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() from 15 to 30°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 300 and 500mm, in forests. Feeding an ocelot enough times will tame it into a $(l:mechanics/pets)Cat$(). Ocelots can eat raw fish
$(thing)Ramming$() animals occasionally attempt to charge nearby creatures, including the player. Their attacks are powerful, but can be dodged. They will ram more frequently if attacked.
pages.title: Ramming

pages.name: Boar
pages.text: The boar spawns at $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 25°C and above -5°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 130 and 400mm.
The moose spawns in forests at $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 10°C and above -15°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 150 and 300mm.
The wildebeest spawns in open plains at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() above 13°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 90 and 380mm.
$(thing)Prey$() animals fear players and predators. They are adept at fleeing from danger, but generally cannot fight back. Some prey animals enjoy snacking on crops.
pages.title: Prey

pages.name: Rabbit
pages.text: The rabbit is known to chew on carrots and cabbage. They are ubiquitous in the world, changing their coat based on climate. They only need 15mm of $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() to spawn.

pages.name: Fox
pages.text: The fox likes to eat the berries off of bushes. It can be found in forests with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 25°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 130 and 400mm.
The deer spawns in forests at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 25°C and above -15°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 130 and 400mm.

pages.name: Caribou
pages.text: The caribou spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below -9°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 110 and 500mm.
The gazelle spawns in open plains at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() above 12°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 90 and 380mm.

pages.name: Bongo
pages.text: The bongo spawns in forests at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() above 15°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 230 and 500mm.
The grouse spawns at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 13°C and above -12°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 150 and 400mm.
The pheasant spawns in forests at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 17°C and above -5°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 100 and 300mm.
The turkey spawns in forests at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() below 17°C and above 0°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 250 and 450mm.

pages.name: Peafowl
pages.text: The peafowl spawns in forests at any $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() above 14°C, and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() between 190 and 500mm.

$(thing)Aquatic Animals$() are a broad category which covers a number of different behaviors. They may be $(thing)Shore Dwellers$(), $(thing)Fish$(), $(thing)Shellfish$(), or $(thing)Large Aquatic Creatures$()
pages.title: Aquatic Animals

pages.text: $(thing)Shore Animals$() only spawn on sea shores and spend some of their day swimming, and some walking on the beach. They are curious creatures, and will follow the player around, but cannot be tamed.

pages.name: Penguin
pages.text: The penguin spawns in only the coldest beaches, with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at most -14°C and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 75mm.

pages.name: Sea Turtle
pages.text: The sea turtle likes warm water. It spawns in $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 21°C and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 250mm.
$(thing)Fish$() are small creatures that swim in water. Most of them can be $(l:mechanics/fishing)fished$(). Some prefer oceans, rivers, or lakes.
pages.title: Fish

pages.name: Cod
pages.text: Cod prefer colder oceans, $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() at most 18°C. They can be fished.

pages.name: Pufferfish
pages.text: Pufferfish live in any ocean with at least a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of 10°C.

pages.name: Jellyfish
pages.text: Jellyfish live in warmer oceans, with a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 18°C.

pages.name: Tropical Fish
pages.text: Tropical fish prefer warmer oceans, with a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 18°C.

pages.name: Salmon
pages.text: Salmon spawn in any river or lake with a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least -5°C.

pages.name: Bluegill
pages.text: Bluegill spawn in any river or lake with a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least -10°C and at most 26°C.

$(thing)Shellfish$() are small animals that live on the floor of bodies of water. They cannot be fished, but drop shells that can be eaten or made into $(l:mechanics/flux)flux$(). Shellfish can be $(l:mechanics/fishing)bait$() for fish.
pages.title: Shellfish

pages.name: Isopod
pages.text: Isopods spawn in deeper sections of oceans of $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() at most 14°C.

pages.name: Lobster
pages.text: Lobster spawn in any ocean that is at most of a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of 21°C.

pages.name: Crayfish
pages.text: Crayfish are like lobster, but spawn in rivers and lakes. They need a $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 5°C and a $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 125mm.

pages.name: Horseshoe Crab
pages.text: Horseshoe crabs spawn in oceans of moderate climate, $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() between 10 and 21°C and with a $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at most 400mm.
$(thing)Large Water Creatures$() are larger animals that live in the bigger bodies of water. Some of them hunt fish. They drop $(l:mechanics/lamps#tallow)blubber$(), which can be made into lamp fuel.
pages.title: Large Water Creatures

pages.name: Orca
pages.text: Orca whales live in deep oceans with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at most 19°C and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 100mm.

pages.name: Dolphin
pages.text: Dolphins live in deep oceans with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 10°C and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at least 200mm.

pages.name: Manatee
pages.text: Manatees live in any warm lake, with $(l:the_world/climate#temperature)temperature$() of at least 20°C and $(l:the_world/climate#rainfall)rainfall$() of at most 300mm.
Squid can spawn in any deep ocean. They drop $(thing)Ink Sacs$(), and ink any player that gets too close. Some say that squids in deep, unexplored caves have strange properties.
pages.title: Squid
